answers.author: William McCauley
answers.text:
Douglas, here is some free consulting for you. If you cannot afford to pay for a vehicle, then you cannot afford the financing costs of leasing. Lease purchase is a private sector concept because they can write off the interest. There is no such benefit to municipalities. The benefit to a city is that they get to buy something they cannot aford. If it is equipment with a big price tag, roll it into a bond issue and pay it out over the useful life of the asset. Have a great day.

answers.author: Deborah Bond
answers.text:
An excellent question for these tough times.  We have been working on and off with Enterprise Car Rental in determining if indeed we would see a cost savings that would out way some of the disadvantages to leasing. They have invested quite a bit in the analysis and advantages for leasing for governments and have some big clients.  We are now at a point where we will take a portion of our inspector fleet and move it to leasing.  For us it was more a question of limited capacity in our fleet maintenance staff since there have been cuts there and this seemed like a good solution that did not add to our costs to manage our fleet and should help us move into more fuel efficient vehicles on a shorter time frame than   saving up to buy replacement vehicles.
 I recommend you contact them and have them do an analysis for you.  Here is contact Information: Rob Ladousier, Government Marketing Mgr, Fleet Mgmt Division, St Louis, MO - Robert.C.Ladousier@erac.com   (314)512-3906
